notes: Discourse marker; "well" for transitions, "okay" for agreement, "I see" for understanding
Exclamation; keep if emphatic, "hey" casual, "oh" surprise
Respectful address for older women; can keep as "aunty"
just for limitation, "enough" for stopping, "that's it" for finality
Term of endearment or addressing youth; "son" male, "child" neutral, "dear" affectionate
Respectful for older male; "brother" literal, "sir" respectful
Visual attention; "look" for pointing, "see" for understanding
Respectful for older female; "sister" literal, "ma'am" respectful
Exaggeration; can keep as "drama" or use alternatives
Honorific suffix; "sir" for males, "ma'am" for females, omit if repetitive
Creative solution; "makeshift fix" literal, "workaround" tech, "hack" casual
Question word or exclamation; "what" for questions, "really" for emphasis

alternatives: what's up|what's going on|what's the deal

notes: Praise; "well done" formal, "bravo" enthusiastic, "good job" casual
Respectful address for older men; can keep as "uncle"
Context-dependent; "that" for objects, pronouns for people
Use "dude" for young male; "man" neutral; "buddy" friendly
